page.title: 06FARMING:AROUND MKT WESTON
page.content: There are 12 farms: 9 owned by the families occupying them, 3 rented from the County Council. All are worked by the families occupying them and only one employs permanent help.Some land is farmed by people who live in nearby areas. The main crops are wheat,barley, oats sugarbeet & grass. The beet is processed at the regional sugar factory in Bury St Edmunds;the grass is for hay silage or pasture. Two farms have dairy herds whose milk is sold to the Milk Marketing Board - one has Friesian and one has Jersey cattle.Some Jersey milk is sold locally. One farm produces vegetables,eggs & poultry which are sold in its farm shop, together with vegetables & fruit from wholesale markets. The whole area has several rights of way for walkers. The fen area is too wet for cultivation & has become a nature reserve,open to walkers.
